title: Inland Revenue, Wellington
description: In this role I perform level 1 service desk troubleshooting (shift left means we end up doing a bit more than level 1), portfolio management, knowledge management, internal QA, phishing, and have lots of meetings. My portfolios are to look after the CISO and Cyber Security team, as well as our old tax system - if any tickets for some reason come in for that. I have gained experience in ServiceNow and Microsoft 365 (Enterprise) in this role. I have also gained a certification in ITIL 4 Foundations (hence the shift left remark earlier).

title: Inland Revenue, Upper Hutt
description: My first full-time job after completing my Bachelor of Software Engineering in 2023. I became my team's 'IT guy', and then became the Upper Hutt office point of contact for the IT team in the Wellington. The role itself helped me understand how our tax system works, finally. After completing our general training, I was then trained to help customers with employer related questions. This meant the majority of my work had me assisting employers and their payroll teams/accountants with their employer specific tax queries.

title: McDonalds Silverstream
description: My part-time job while I was studying. I filtered and cleaned the oil vats, moved things around in the freezer, cleaned up equipment after breakfast, made burgers/fries/drinks and so on.
